Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2009 09:33PM johannaw wrote: 3 weeks before leaving for Florida for the winter I decided to have a mammogram for routine screening.  I had had a lump removed on left side 11 years ago which was benign and have had regular mammograms all of these years with the exception of the last year.  Mammogam came back with suspicious spots on right side so 4 sterotactic biopsies were performed. Three came back with Lobular carcinoma in SITU.  We put our trip on hold and made appointment with Onc. Surgeon.  She said, not a major problem as it is not invasive but she still wanted me to have an MRI.  MRI confirmed what was going on on right side but also showed a suspicious area on the left side.  Of couse I assumed it was probably just scar tissue from the previous lumpectomy but was totally blown away when I had a MRI guided biopsy that came back with invasive lobular carcinoma.   Have an appt. this Tues. to discuss plan of action.   After the initial first news I was shaken up for a few days but felt confident it was just a small bump in the road and early detection and soon will be ready to go.  This second dx. has really hit home and I know I will have to make some drastic decisions.  It helps a lot to have so many friends and family showing so much concern.  I am also very grateful for sites like this to read about many other people's thoughts, concerns and what I will be facing very soon.  Keep up the good work girls.  I am with you all in this had time we all have to go thru.  Take care and let's all keep encouraging each other
